content.text:
Based on the search results, here are the latest developments in Ruby on Rails:

1. Recent Versions and Support

citations.cited_text: The latest update was in May 2023, which was Rails 7.0.5, which made various updates to a range of gems.

citations.cited_text: Starting with 7.2, each minor release (7.2, 8.0, etc.) is officially supported based on a fixed, yearly duration: 1 year for bug fixes and 2 years for...
citations.title: Ruby on Rails | endoflife.date

content.text:
Starting with version 7.2, each minor release will be:
- Supported for 1 year with bug fixes
- Supported for 2 years with security fixes

citations.cited_text: Yet, Ruby on Rails’ popularity has resurged in recent years. Hired’s 2023 State of Software Engineers report found Ruby on Rails was the most in-deman...
citations.title: Best of 2024: The Ruby on Rails Resurgence - DevOps.com

content.text: Ruby on Rails has experienced a resurgence, with the Hired 2023 State of Software Engineers report finding it the most in-demand skill for software engineering roles. Proficiency in Ruby on Rails resulted in 1.64 times more interview opportunities.

citations.cited_text: This resurgence has been significantly bolstered by innovations like Hotwire and the sorting out of its JavaScript integration.
citations.title: Best of 2024: The Ruby on Rails Resurgence - DevOps.com

content.text: The resurgence has been significantly bolstered by innovations like Hotwire and improvements in JavaScript integration

citations.cited_text: Rails 6.0 brought some significant improvements, including Action Mailbox for handling incoming emails, Action Text which enables rich-text content an...
citations.title: Ruby On Rails Development Trends: 2024 & Beyond

citations.cited_text: Rails 6.0 brought some significant improvements, including Action Mailbox for handling incoming emails, Action Text which enables rich-text content an...
citations.title: Ruby On Rails Development Trends: 2024 & Beyond

content.text:
Previous major updates (Rails 6.0) brought significant improvements, including:
- Action Mailbox for handling incoming emails
- Action Text for rich-text content and editing
- Multiple database support
- Parallel testing
- Webpacker as the default JavaScript builder
- Zeitwerk code loader

citations.title: Best of 2024: The Ruby on Rails Resurgence - DevOps.com

citations.cited_text: In short, development teams are being asked to produce more with the same or fewer resources, and that’s precisely where Rails shines.
citations.title: Best of 2024: The Ruby on Rails Resurgence - DevOps.com

content.text: Ruby on Rails continues to provide a framework that enables faster development and speed to market. Development teams are increasingly looking for tools that help them produce more with the same or fewer resources, which is where Rails excels.

citations.cited_text: Well-known sites that use Ruby on Rails include Airbnb, Archive of our Own, Crunchbase, Dribbble, GitHub, Twitch and Shopify.
citations.title: Ruby on Rails - Wikipedia

content.text: Well-known sites using Ruby on Rails include Airbnb, GitHub, Twitch, and Shopify

citations.cited_text: Among the many applications built with Ruby on Rails are Airbnb, Basecamp, Github, Hulu and Shopify. Ruby on Rails took a backseat to JavaScript in th...
citations.title: Best of 2024: The Ruby on Rails Resurgence - DevOps.com

content.text: While it took a backseat to JavaScript in the late 2010s, many developers continued to use it to rapidly build API layers for JavaScript front-ends, largely because Rails makes development so simple.

citations.cited_text: Another driver is the recognition of the importance of developer happiness.Ruby on Rails is having a much-deserved resurgence because it enables teams...
citations.title: Best of 2024: The Ruby on Rails Resurgence - DevOps.com

content.text: The framework is gaining recognition not just for its technical capabilities, but also for improving developer happiness. As a free, open-source project, it enables teams to rapidly develop innovative web apps for clients who need quick deployment, potentially helping developers maintain a better work-life balance.
